articles.author: New York Post
articles.title: Bragg’s political prosecution: Letters to the Editor - April 6, 2023
articles.description: Post readers discuss Manhattan DA Alvin Bragg's charges against former President Donald Trump.
articles.content:
The Issue: The arraignment of former President Donald Trump for 34 counts of falsifying business records.
Stab someone, and Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg will plead it down (“Trumped up,” April 5).
Rape someone, and Alvin will plead it down... [3707 chars]

articles.title: Trump makes play for DeSantis donors
articles.description: Donald Trump’s campaign is reaching out directly to Ron DeSantis' donors to convince them to jump ship.
articles.content: The memo — which was equal parts a jab at DeSantis and an actual appeal for support — displays how the Trump campaign is seeking to capitalize on his current strength in polling ahead of the 2024 presidential primary. The former president has seen hi... [1842 chars]

articles.description: Melania Trump “lives in an ivory tower of denial,” said a friend of the former first lady – who was absent as her husband made his first public comments after becoming the first commander-in-chief in US history to be arraigned on criminal charges.

articles.author: News18
articles.title: Trump Asks Republicans in Congress to Defund Justice Department and FBI
articles.description: Former President Donald Trump on Wednesday called on his fellow Republicans in Congress to slash funding for the U.S. Justice Department and the FBI, one day after pleading not guilty in New York to 34 felony counts of falsifying business records. Trump, who is seeking to regain the presidency in 2024, took aim at federal law enforcement authorities.
articles.content:
Former President Donald Trump on Wednesday called on his fellow Republicans in Congress to slash funding for the U.S. Justice Department and the FBI, one day after pleading not guilty in New York to 34 felony counts of falsifying business records.

articles.author: New York Post
articles.title: How frightening new AI Midjourney creates realistic fake art
articles.description: People were recently baffled by AI art of Donald Trump being aggressively arrested and Pope Francis in a Balenciaga coat circulating widely online. They were fakes — but incredibly convincing ones. Both were created by AI Midjourney, a program that’s rapidly changing art and graphics design.
articles.content:
It puts the art in artificial intelligence.
People were recently baffled by photos of Donald Trump being aggressively arrested by the NYPD and Pope Francis sporting a luxurious Balenciaga puffy coat circulating widely online.
They were fakes — but in... [6278 chars]

articles.author: New York Post
articles.title: Bragg's indictment pretends politicians never suppress embarrassing info
articles.description: Alvin Bragg said he’s charging Donald Trump with 34 felonies because Trump sought to "suppress negative information” to boost his chances in the 2016 election.
articles.content:
Does Manhattan prosecutor Alvin Bragg believe political campaigns are governed by the Boy Scout oath and every candidate must be honest, trustworthy, clean and maybe reverent, too?

articles.title: Did Donald Trump Ask for 'Retribution by the Courts' in 1989 Newspaper Ad?
articles.description: He placed ads in four newspapers in 1989 demanding reinstatement of the death penalty after a woman was mugged, beaten, and raped in Central Park.

articles.title: Now Trump wants to defund the DoJ and FBI
articles.description: Donald Trump, who is seeking to regain the presidency in 2024, took aim at federal law enforcement authorities even though the criminal charges against him were pursued not by them but by the Manhattan district attorney.
articles.content:
Congressional Republicans have called for sharp federal spending cuts in return for voting to raise the US debt ceiling but have yet to put forward specific proposals.

articles.description: G.O.P. leaders have talked tough about investigating the New York prosecutor bringing charges against the former president, but behind the scenes, they are weighing how to move ahead.

articles.title: Fresh proof Bragg's Trump case is a reach, and nakedly political
articles.description: The numbers don’t lie: Manhattan DA Alvin Bragg’s case against Trump is a massive outlier, not the “bread and butter” move the crime-lover claimed it was.
articles.content:
The numbers don’t lie: Manhattan DA Alvin Bragg’s case against Trump is a massive outlier, not the “bread and butter” move the crime-lover claimed it was.

articles.author: CBC.ca
articles.title: Trump charges are a first in the U.S. How have trials for world leaders played out elsewhere?
articles.description: Donald Trump has become the first sitting or former U.S. president to face criminal charges, but history shows that leaders have faced trial in other established democracies without shaking trust in those institutions.
articles.content:

articles.author: The New York Times
articles.title: Trump’s Charges Bring Doubts, Hopes and Uncertainty in Both Parties
articles.description: To some Republicans and Democrats, the charges appeared flimsy and less consequential than many had hoped. To others, the case had the potential to reverberate politically.
articles.content: In an ordinary presidential-primary season, the indictment of a front-runner over hush money paid to a porn star would, at the least, be an opening for rivals to attack. But a day after the arraignment of former President Donald J. Trump on 34 felony... [815 chars]

articles.author: The New York Times
articles.title: Do Critics of Trump’s Indictment Have a Point?
articles.description: This case may be a legal stretch, but it would be a problem to give a boss impunity after imprisoning his underling.
articles.content:
There have been parallel felony prosecutions in New York, but apparently never one involving a federal election. It’s too early to assess the case fully, but my impression is that Bragg’s argument is plausible but not a slam-dunk.

articles.title: Opinion | The Gaping Hole in the Middle of the Trump Indictment
articles.description: What exactly are the ‘other crimes’ the former president is alleged to have committed that justify bringing the case?
